input_text:
Job Title: Advanced Mechanical Design Engineer - Methods

Location: Phoenix, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

Imagine, design and develop products and systems as part of a highly engaged and integrated engineering team. You will collaborate across Honeywell Aerospace engineering teams to create solutions and systems that meet the evolving needs of our customers. You will participate in all phases of product development and will be a coach and mentor to less experienced engineers.

Honeywell is implementing advanced gas turbine system technologies in a number of our aircraft propulsion products and auxiliary power units. Dramatic improvements to the fidelity of simulations used in the design processes of gas turbines are essential to shorten development cycles while meeting customer requirements on these projects. You will be responsible for leading activities within the Fan and Compressor Design Systems methods group to drive continued development of predictive tools to assess mechanical behavior. As part of that effort you will also be responsible for developing software tools to automate custom workflows. You will also be expected to provide guidance to fan and compressor design teams on the use of best practices for general mechanical modeling and measurements and will develop new processes in these areas. You will help lead root cause investigations of mechanical failures to enable rapid resolution.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and improve modeling methods and best practices for static, modal and forced response analyses in turbomachinery.Integrate static, modal, thermal and forced response analyses best practices into Honeywell design workflows with emphasis on accuracy and cycle time reductionDevelop software utilities to automate analysis workflows. Also, work with software developer teams to define and guide the development of software utilities.Guide design teams on use of best practices for mechanical modeling and measurements (linear and non-linear stress analysis, modal analysis, high-cycle fatigue)Provide leadership of root cause investigations into mechanical failures in fans and compressors and the selection of appropriate design or fabrication changes

U.s. Person Requirements

Due to compliance with U.S. export control laws and regulations, candidate must be a U.S. Person, which is defined as, a U.S. citizen, a U.S. permanent resident, or have protected status in the U.S. under asylum or refugee status or have the ability to obtain an export authorization

YOU MUST HAVE

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution in a technical discipline such as the sciences, technology, engineering, or mathematics.Five years of aerospace or mechanical engineering experience in finite element analysis based modelingDemonstrated aerospace or mechanical engineering experience in developing and improving modeling methods and best practices

WE VALUE

Advanced degree in Aerospace or Mechanical engineeringAbility to solve complex engineering problemsExperience in developing and validating simulation processes with COTS toolsExperience in mechanical analysis of aerospace structuresProgramming aptitude and experience, preferably in MATLAB

Benefits

Benefits provided may differ by role and location. Learn more at benefits.honeywell.com.

 Unlimited Vacation Plan with No Preset Maximums Flexible Hybrid Work Schedule Medical/Rx Health Savings Account (HSA) Dental/Vision Short/Long-Term Disability Employee Assistance Program (EAP) 401(k) Plan Education Assistance Friendly and inclusive work environment fostering creativity and growth.

Additional Information

JOB ID: req443232Category: EngineeringLocation: 111 S 34th St.,Phoenix,Arizona,85034,United StatesExemptDue to US export control laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident or have protected status.

Engineering (GLOBAL)

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
